name: Sum of Cubes
statement: You are given a positive integer $$$x$$$. Check whether the number $$$x$$$ is representable as the sum of the cubes of two positive integers. Formally, you need to check if there are two integers $$$a$$$ and $$$b$$$ ($$$1 \le a, b$$$) such that $$$a^3+b^3=x$$$. For example, if $$$x = 35$$$, then the numbers $$$a=2$$$ and $$$b=3$$$ are suitable ($$$2^3+3^3=8+27=35$$$). If $$$x=4$$$, then no pair of numbers $$$a$$$ and $$$b$$$ is suitable.
inputFormat: The first line contains one integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 100$$$) â€” the number of test cases. Then $$$t$$$ test cases follow. Each test case contains one integer $$$x$$$ ($$$1 \le x \le 10^{12}$$$). Please note, that the input for some test cases won't fit into $$$32$$$-bit integer type, so you should use at least $$$64$$$-bit integer type in your programming language.
outputFormat: For each test case, output on a separate line: " YES " if $$$x$$$ is representable as the sum of the cubes of two positive integers. " NO " otherwise. You can output " YES " and " NO " in any case (for example, the strings yEs , yes , Yes and YES will be recognized as positive).

sampleTests.output:
NO
YES
NO
NO
YES
YES
YES
